title: Source cache does not present a git repo for packages with a git source
body:
Consider the following `demo` package:

```diff
diff --git a/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/demo/package.py b/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/demo/package.py
new file mode 100644
index 000000000..c7dde8cbc
--- /dev/null
+++ b/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/demo/package.py
@@ -0,0 +1,9 @@
+from spack import *
+
+class Demo(Package):
+    git = 'https://github.com/FairRootGroup/FairLogger.git' # just any git repo
+    version('1.6.0', commit='b9edcd623d758b79bb0d424c02c71239b2cc6b2a')
+    phases = ['check_if_git_repo']
+
+    def check_if_git_repo(self, spec, prefix):
+        Executable('git describe')()
```

### Steps to reproduce the issue

Using Spack `v0.13.2-685-g9ed34f686`:

```console
$ spack clean -d && spack install -v demo && spack uninstall -y demo && spack install -v demo                   
==> Removing cached downloads
==> Installing demo
==> Searching for binary cache of demo
==> No binary for demo found: installing from source
==> Cloning git repository: https://github.com/FairRootGroup/FairLogger.git at commit b9edcd623d758b79bb0d424c02c71239b2cc6b2a
==> No checksum needed when fetching with git
==> Already staged spack-stage-demo-1.6.0-4pyawof7uxjf3atqulp4rr4rit4i5jq2 in /tmp/dklein/spack-stage/spack-stage-demo-1.6.0-4pyawof7uxjf3atqulp4rr4rit4i5jq2
==> No patches needed for demo
==> Building demo [Package]
==> Executing phase: 'check_if_git_repo'
==> [2020-01-02-13:34:13.486880] 'git' 'describe'
v1.6.0
==> Successfully installed demo
  Fetch: 1.34s.  Build: 0.21s.  Total: 1.55s.
[+] /home/dklein/.spack/install_tree/linux-fedora31-skylake/gcc-9.2.1/demo-1.6.0-4pyawof7uxjf3atqulp4rr4rit4i5jq2
==> Successfully uninstalled demo@1.6.0%gcc@9.2.1 arch=linux-fedora31-skylake/4pyawof
==> Installing demo
==> Searching for binary cache of demo
==> No binary for demo found: installing from source
==> Using cached archive: /home/dklein/.spack/source_cache/_source-cache/git//FairRootGroup/FairLogger.git/b9edcd623d758b79bb0d424c02c71239b2cc6b2a.tar.gz
==> Warning: Fetching from mirror without a checksum!
  This package is normally checked out from a version control system, but it has been archived on a spack mirror.  This means we cannot know a checksum for the tarball in advance. Be sure that your connection to this mirror is secure!
==> Staging archive: /tmp/dklein/spack-stage/spack-stage-demo-1.6.0-4pyawof7uxjf3atqulp4rr4rit4i5jq2/b9edcd623d758b79bb0d424c02c71239b2cc6b2a.tar.gz
==> Created stage in /tmp/dklein/spack-stage/spack-stage-demo-1.6.0-4pyawof7uxjf3atqulp4rr4rit4i5jq2
==> No patches needed for demo
==> Building demo [Package]
==> Executing phase: 'check_if_git_repo'
==> [2020-01-02-13:34:15.271202] 'git' 'describe'
fatal: not a git repository (or any parent up to mount point /)
Stopping at filesystem boundary (GIT_DISCOVERY_ACROSS_FILESYSTEM not set).
==> Error: ProcessError: Command exited with status 128:
    'git' 'describe'
See build log for details:
  /tmp/dklein/spack-stage/spack-stage-demo-1.6.0-4pyawof7uxjf3atqulp4rr4rit4i5jq2/spack-build-out.txt
...
```

### Error Message

```
==> [2020-01-02-13:34:15.271202] 'git' 'describe'
fatal: not a git repository (or any parent up to mount point /)
```

The staged source directory from a source cache does not present as a git repo as it is the case when staging from upstream. The reason for this behaviour appears to be https://github.com/spack/spack/blob/9ed34f686fc605d2e5dfbb15b14ed8d63fdb7c72/lib/spack/spack/fetch_strategy.py#L870 which archives the working tree instead of the git repo.

On a second note, the same source caching strategy seems to result in the following warning
```
==> Warning: Fetching from mirror without a checksum!
  This package is normally checked out from a version control system, but it has been archived on a spack mirror.  This means we cannot know a checksum for the tarball in advance. Be sure that your connection to this mirror is secure!
```
which is rather disappointing since the package spec contains the git commit hash with which one could reconstruct the working tree from a cached git repo.

---

1. As a package maintainer, should I be able to expect that the staged source directory (from a package with a git source) presents itself as a git repository clone even when staged from the cache? (=> If yes, consider this issue as a bug report, if no, consider this issue as resolved and thank you for clarifying the intended behaviour.)

2. Regardless of the previous, would you consider accepting a contribution which changes the source caching strategy of the `GitFetchStrategy` to rather archive the git repo (just the `.git` directory without the working tree) and then reconstruct the working tree using the commit hash from the package spec? (=> Fixing the unsafe warning for that case.)

Cc: @ChristianTackeGSI
